ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Making a timeline for research and writing.
further develop skills learned in past hshm courses. Added lesson of finding credible evidence.

developed skills in primary research and thesis writing, including exploring yale's archives in the medical historical library and the law library. I continue to develop my thesis, which has undergone many alterations since its topic shifted to Thomsonianism's legacy in 19th c. america.
i learned about what writing a senior thesis entails, the effort that should be put in, and what it means to genuinely pick a topic that i love. It is important to choose your passion.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I wish there were actual meetings like 3 times a semester to really talk with other people in your major.
this course starts when you start working. thats what can make it difficult and easy. Independent work is hard but finding an advisor that provides deadlines is very helpful.
Netting more frequently with my cohort.
I need to work quicker and stay on task with assignments in the upcoming semester. Otherwise, everything went smoothly!

strengths - very responsive and willing to meet and provide advice. 
weaknesses - no weaknesses, so understanding

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
